metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20021 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
LibVNC before commit c3115350eb8bb635d0fdb4dbbb0d0541f38ed19c contains aCWE-835: Infinite loop vulnerability in VNC client code. Vulnerabilityallows attacker to consume excessive amount of resources like CPU and RAM

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20021` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncserver-config - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.4
libvncserver0 - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.4
linuxvnc - 0.9.9+dfsg-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

tightvncserver - 1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1
xtightvncviewer - 1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
